title: Riot, in which patch will be the mini-rework to Aurelion Sol?
body: Weeks ago, you comment something about a mini-rework for Aurelion Sol to make him a little more easier that is actually to improve the number of players of this champ. All of this is true? If it is, when will we know something about this rework? Thanks {{champion:136}} (Sorry if you didnt understand something, I´m Spanish and I wanted to practice my English :D)

replies.body: It'll be a while. We've got some ideas we want to test, aimed at improving ability satisfaction and improving his skill floor. We haven't got the early version of those into even internal testing yet though (other work's higher priority, pre-season followup especially).
What is This "skill floor." Pleas English :D

Skill floor: How good at a champion you need to be to start playing them somewhat effectively. Tends to be concerned with first handful of games especially (e.g. as my first game on Anivia will I feed and have no fun or be weak but make some meaningful contributions?).

Skill ceiling: How long you can keep getting meaningfully better at a champion. Tends to be concerned about players with hundreds of games (e.g. if I've played 200 games as Singed am I still learning new ways to perform better?).

Have you thought of moving the knockback on his R to his Q while his stun moves to his R? Sure different animations/particles would be needed but this could help him be less binary. His E, idc if you change it much or not.

I love his W and passive please don't take those away from Sol.

Aurelion Sol's weakness is if you can manage to get in close combat. One concept for ultimates is to overcome your weakness for a short window of power.

If you move the knockback to his Q, that would mean that you basically killed his weakness. Since he can peel himself more reliably and more often.

They can't do this, otherwise Aurelion Sol would be hell of imbalanced. At least if his passive and W are going to stay.
So are you lowering or raising the skill floor? That's what I personally did not quite understand when you said "improving his skill floor"

I imagine his mini-update will lower his skill floor, since it's currently a little too high. Ideally, you'd want a champion to have the lowest skill floor and highest skill ceiling possible, and while not every champion will be easy to pick up, every champion needs to have at least some baseline level of effectiveness, so that you can do at least okay in your first few matches. One of Aurelion's main issues right now is that it can take a very long time before you get the hang of him, and before that he can feel a bit too difficult to control effectively.
What is rumbles skill floor and skill ceiling?
Whatever you do, please keep the BOOP line.
Tbh making him say ''Boop'' whenever a star Boops an enemy champion, the satisfaction goals wouldbe fullfilled.

Do you think the other "roam" mages {{champion:4}}  {{champion:163}}  could also be looked at too in order to make what they bring to the table more clear?

{{champion:163}} - Environment creating/shaping 
{{champion:136}} - "Grand Entries" or initiation
{{champion:4}}  - high single target damage and disruption

so this way they dont "overlap" or "overshadow" each other and cause problems like how {{champion:163}} gave {{champion:4}} a run for his money?

Please make him more thematically in tune with his stars. He also feels too prone to CC in a sense. Like if a morg Q's you or anything you are just destined for death. He could be an amazing support if he had more peel capabilities too.
I like the urf version of him where he gets more stars as the game progresses
Will he be more than just three stars orbiting a dragon? cause the concept of aurelion sol appeals to me so much but he's just kind of dull to play.

And why don't you make his q be able to detonate immediately, or at least quicker. And/or making it so whenever I get stunned I don't get dropped with 100% certainty. I understand his intentional weakness, but I think he gets too heavily punishrd by cc and champs with gap closers. They jump on you, you peel, they jump on you again and you're dead. He's my favorite champio ln and I like his skill floor and ceiling. Tbh I like being the only bronze player to play him (and be good with him) I hope what I love about him isn't taken away. (Also dark star Aurelion Sol?)
